climbs.name: They Might Be Giants
climbs.fa: Aid route - Harrison Shull et al  Free route - Tim Snyder, Nathan Brown

content.description: Start below the arete and step across gap to wall.  Climb past funky gear to a line of 3 bolts that lead through bouldery rock.  Just above the crux bolt there is a horizontal that takes a good hand size cam (and a hand) that you'll definitely wanna get.  Continue up juggy but powerful climbing a ways to the next gear at a horizontal and an old weathered tricam.  Climb steep but easier terrain to the double bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Just left of "killer of giants" arete.  Start on a rock ledge below the upper arete.

content.description:
Climb into the hole and clip a high bolt.  Boulder through bulge to a small ledge.  Continue up and slightly left through the steep juggy wall, placing gear in horizontals as you go.  There is a 2 bolt anchor up and right to lower from at the top.

Note: there is a mixed variation that splits right from the stance above the bolt.  It's called "Zombie Apocalypse".
content.location: Start to the right of "Killer Of Giants" at the hole feature with a bolt.

climbs.name: Killer Of Giants
climbs.fa: direct finish - Nathan Brown, Tim Snyder 2011   left variation FFA Nathan Brown

content.description:
This is, in my opinion, an excellent route for the grade, despite some hollow rock in the middle portion of the route.  It is very steep and will make even the strongest climbers struggle with the impending forearm pump!

Climb past a pin and 3 bolts to a stance.  Continue up the arete past gear (including a fixed stainless stopper) and a bolt.  Continue up the arete to a bolt/chain anchor.

There is a left variation that is easier and moves left at last bolt to the anchors for "They Might Be Giants".
content.protection: standard rack up to #2 or 3 camelot
content.location: Climbs the northeast arete of the feature to a chain anchor at the top.
